content.title: Disability Pension For Registered Worker (HBOCWWB)
content.department: Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana
content.details: The scheme 'Disability Pension for Registered Worker (HBOCWWB)' was launched by the Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana. Under the scheme, a monthly pension of ₹3000/- is given to the registered worker in case of disability due to any infectious disease or accident at the workplace. Further, it is necessary for the registered worker to have minimum three-year regular membership and is not taking a disability pension from any other Haryana Government Department/ Board/ Corporation.
benefits: A pension of ₹3000/- per month is given to the worker in case of disability due to any infectious disease or accident at the workplace.
eligibility: The worker should be registered under Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB).
The registered worker must have minimum three-year regular memberships.
The registered worker who has become disabled due to any infectious disease or accident at the workplace during the course of employment is eligible to apply under the scheme.
The percentage of permanent disability should be between 70% to 100%.
The worker must not be taking a disability pension from any other Haryana Government Department/ Board/ Corporation.
documents_required: Identity proof i.e. Aadhaar Card, Voter Card
No Objection Certificate issued by the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, a monthly pension of ₹3000/- is given to the registered worker in case of disability due to any infectious disease or accident at the workplace who has minimum three-year regular membership and is not taking a disability pension from any other Haryana Government Department/ Board/ Corporation.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The registered worker who has become disabled due to any infectious disease or accident at the workplace during the course of employment is eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: Can a general category worker be eligible to apply under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is for all categories of workers.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for a resident of Haryana State?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should be a permanent resident/domicile of Haryana State.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory for workers to have a regular membership of the board?
faqs.answer: Yes, the registered applicant must have minimum three-year regular memberships.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: A pension of ₹3000/- per month is given to the worker in case of disability due to any infectious disease or accident at the workplace.

faqs.question: What should be the percentage of disability to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The percentage of permanent disability should be between 70% to 100%.

faqs.question: Is a worker taking a disability pension from any other Haryana Government Department/ Board/ Corporation eligible to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the applicant must not be taking a disability pension from any other Haryana Government Department/ Board/ Corporation.

faqs.question: How can a construction worker get registered under HBOCWWB?
faqs.answer: For registration, the construction worker should visit the Official Website of the Labour Department Haryana.

faqs.question: Is there any registration fee needed while registering under HBOCWWB?
faqs.answer: Yes, the first-time registration charges are ₹25/- and the registration fees vary according to the renewal time period.

faqs.question: How can a construction worker apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The eligible construction worker may apply online mode.

faqs.question: How can a construction worker apply online under the scheme?
faqs.answer: For online application, the construction worker should visit the Official Portal - Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.
